references.reason: This paper introduces the fundamental theory and framework of denoising diffusion probabilistic models, a core technology used extensively in the UniEdit framework.

references.paper_title: Lumiere: A space-time diffusion model for video generation
references.reason: Lumiere is the foundation model used in the UniEdit experiments, providing a direct link to the practical implementation and success of the methods.

references.paper_title: Pix2video: Video editing using image diffusion
references.reason: Pix2Video is a pioneering work on video editing leveraging image diffusion models, inspiring the inversion-then-generation approach that UniEdit adapts and expands upon.

references.paper_title: Masactrl: Tuning-free mutual self-attention control for consistent image synthesis and editing
references.reason: MasaCtrl provides critical insights into tuning-free content preservation and control methods, which are key innovations directly adopted and adapted within the UniEdit framework.

references.paper_title: Dreamix: Video diffusion models are general video editors
references.reason: Dreamix is another foundational text-guided video editing method demonstrating that video diffusion models are adaptable to complex editing tasks, influencing the design choices and goals in UniEdit.
